overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [9] This measure repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [9] [9] It also lapses all unencumbered funds from the repealed funds to the newly established University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund and appropriates funds from it. [9] [9]
appropriations: There is an appropriation out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [8] The bill specifies the sum of $ (HB1169_SD1) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [8] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for the purposes of this Act. [8]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [9]
agency_impact: The University of Hawai ªi System testified in support of the measure. [9] Creating a single University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, with each campus having an account, would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs and eliminate redundant provisions. [9] This structure would also be consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds, like the Tuition and Fees Special Fund. [9]
economic_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [9]
policy_impact: This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [8] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [8] The measure adds a new section to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for all conference center programs conducted by the university. [8] [8]
revenue_sources: The bill establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [8] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [8] Additionally, on July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds from the repealed conference center revolving funds for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the community colleges shall lapse to the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [8] [8]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [9]
operating_revenue_impact: The measure establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [8] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [8] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected will be deposited into this revolving fund. [8]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [9]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [9]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The previous fiscal note was based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, while the new fiscal note incorporates changes from S.D. 1 and the accompanying committee report, SSCR1134. [9] The committee report provides a new rationale, stating that a single fund would allow campuses to standardize programs and eliminate redundant provisions. [9] A significant update is the change in the effective date; the Committee has amended the measure by making it effective upon its approval. [9] [9]
fte_positions: The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [9]
appropriations_changes: The appropriation amount remains unspecified in the S.D. 1 version of the bill. [8] It appropriates the sum of $ (HB1169_SD1) for fiscal year 2025-2026. [8] This is consistent with the previous version mentioned in the prior fiscal note. [9]
funding_sources_changes: The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the funding sources for this measure compared to the previous version. [9]
department_impact: The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the University of Hawaii remains the expending agency. [8]
reports_required: The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [8] This report must account for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [8] [8]
pilot_program: The provided documents do not establish a pilot program. [9]
sunset_date: The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [9]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [8] Section 5, regarding the appropriation, shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [8]
